titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I instituted the Rev. A. L. Osman to the tiny parish adjoining Letton: the Rev. T. Clark–Smith to Pipe & Lyde: & the Rev. C. A. Markham Evans to Winforton. In the afternoon two ladies, M
Dunmassey Thomas, came to lay before me their complaint against their parson, W. [G. H.] Davis,

Weonard's for pacifism! He is alleged to have a quite impossible wife, who circulates treasonable literature in the cottages. The fact is that the man is a tactless jackass, pressed by poverty, and full–filled with the nonsense of Christian Socialism
He was once a curate of Jimmie Adderley's.
